result.execSummary:
The defendant James Matthew Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharges. Court waived non-mandatory costs due to defendant's indigency. Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 06-26-2023 to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Matthew Miller

records.addlTxt:
Case recalled. Appearances remain the same.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 130 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 130 days time served.

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

Court waived non-mandatory costs due to defendant's indigency. Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 06/26/2023 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.
Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant James Matthew Miller not in court, in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in route to courtroom. Case passed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant James Matthew Miller not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the bench warrant based on defendant's in custody status.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 37.  Calendar call scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant James Matthew Miller not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Attorney Wentz to review case with defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James Matthew Miller in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant James Matthew Miller in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Matthew Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
